decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells and disruptive cards to control the game while setting up for a powerful combo finish. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to ramp up mana quickly, the deck aims to cast Goblin Charbelcher and activate its ability to deal massive damage to the opponent out of nowhere. The deck also includes creatures like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect to provide additional support and threats on the board. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful combo potential.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing cards like Basking Broodscale, Glaring Fleshraker, and Blade of the Bloodchief to create a formidable board presence. Utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to ramp up mana quickly, the deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opponents. Walking Ballista and Emrakul, the Promised End serve as finishers, while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Grove of the Burnwillows provide additional value and consistency. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with its synergistic combo pieces and versatile card choices.

This deck focuses on utilizing "The Underworld Cookbook" to its fullest potential, combining aggro strategies with powerful artifact recursion and card advantage. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Academy Manufactor help to bring back artifacts from the graveyard, while cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal provide additional mana acceleration. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and constant card advantage, utilizing cards like Time Sieve and Gloomlake Verge to maintain pressure. The deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents through efficient artifact synergies and resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Arena of Glory to maintain board presence and pressure. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide ways to close out the game if needed. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful creature-based aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with various abilities to create powerful combos and synergies, allowing the player to search for specific creatures with Chord of Calling, sacrifice them for value with Carrion Feeder and Viscera Seer, and generate additional mana with Gilded Goose and Birthing Ritual. The toolbox aspect of the deck enables flexibility in response to different situations, while cards like Voice of Victory and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provide additional value and control options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents through efficient creature interactions and combo plays.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through efficient removal spells and disruptive creatures. By utilizing counterspells, removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember, and disruptive creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from mounting a successful offense. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Consider allows the player to dig through their deck for key pieces while disrupting the opponent's hand. Additionally, cards like Unearth provide recursion for key creatures, ensuring a steady stream of threats and answers.
